1.q_string: Circular motion is a ________________.

Find out the magnitude of resultant of two displacement vectors, each having a \(y\) component of \(10 \mathrm{~km}\), are added together to form a resultant that forms an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) from the \(+x\)-axis. \(\left(\sin 60^{\circ}=0.87, \cos 60^{\circ}=0.5\right)\)
Three forces acting on a body are shown in fig. To have the resultant force only along the y-direction, the magnitude of the minimum additional force needed along OX is:

q_option: Path of the particle is a circle of radius \(4 \mathrm{~m}\)
Magnitude of acceleration vector is \(\frac{v^{2}}{R}\), where \(v\) is the velocity of particle.
Magnitude of the velocity of particle is \(8 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\)
1.q_string:
The position vector of a particle \(\vec{R}\) as a function of time is given by:

\(\overrightarrow{\mathrm{R}}=4 \sin (2 \pi t) \hat{i}+4 \cos (2 \pi t) \hat{j} \text {, }\)

Where \(\mathrm{R}\) is in meters, \(\mathrm{t}\) is in seconds and \(\hat{i}\) and \(\hat{j}\) denote unit vectors along \(\mathrm{x}\)-and \(\mathrm{y}\) - directions, respectively. Which one of the following statements is wrong for the motion of particle?

A particle is moving eastwards with a velocity of \(5 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\). In \(10 \mathrm{~s}\), the velocity changes to \(5 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\) northwards. The average acceleration in this time is.

A river is flowing from west to east with a speed of \(5 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~min}^{-1}\). A man can swim in still water with a velocity \(10 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~min}^{-1}\). In which direction should the man swim so as to take the shortest possible path to go to the south?

q_option: Their maximum height will be the same.
Their velocity at the highest point will be the same.
Their time of flight will be the same.
1.q_string: Two projectiles are fired from the same point with the same speed at angles of projection \(60^{\circ}\) and \(30^{\circ}\) respectively. Which one of the following is true?
A particle is projected at an angle 45 degree .The relation between range and maximum height.

A cannon on the level plane is aimed at an angle \(\theta\) above the horizontal and a shell is fired with a muzzle velocity \(v_{0}\) towards the vertical cliff at a distance \(R\) away. The height from the bottom at which the shell strikes the side walls of the cliff is:

A ball is projected upwards from the top of a tower, with velocity 50 ms-1, making an angle 30o with the horizontal. The height of the tower is 70 m. After how many seconds, from the instant of throwing, will the ball reach the ground?
The angle made by the vector \(A=i+j\) with \(x\)-axis is:
The maximum number of vectors of unequal magnitudes required to produce a zero resultant is:

q_option: Are not equal to each other in magnitude
Are equal to each other in magnitude

Both Assertion and Reason are correct but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion

A body with constant acceleration always moves along a straight line.

The magnitude and direction are the same for both

Gives a scalar that is \(\lambda\) times the polar angle of \(\vec{v}\)
Gives a vector \(\overrightarrow{v^{\prime}}=\lambda \vec{v}\) in a direction opposite to \(\vec{v}\)
